title: popple_(mario)
body:
[i]"Oh, sure, [[mario|you]] [[luigi|guys]] are real tough, teaming up on me! Don't think you can beat me just 'cause I'm alone. It's my solo debut on the battle lines, see?"[/i]
     ‚Äî[b]Popple[/b], [i]Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga[/i]

[b]Popple[/b] is a supporting antagonist in [i][[Mario & Luigi: Superstar Saga]][/i], its Nintendo 3DS remake, and a supporting character in [i][[Mario & Luigi: Dream Team]][/i]. Popple, or the "Shadow Thief", as he calls himself, dreams of becoming a super thief and being rich beyond belief. He has a tendency of saying "see?" at the end of most sentences, a common verbal tic for stereotypical thugs and mobsters.

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Popple":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Popple]

title: goombella
body:
[I]"My name's Goombella. I'm a junior at the University of Goom. Nice to meet [[mario|ya]]!"[/i]
     ‚Äî[b]Goombella[/b], [i]Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door[/i]

[b]Goombella[/b] is a major character in [i][[Paper Mario: The Thousand Year Door]][/I], and its Nintendo Switch remake. Goombella is a smart and sassy but friendly [[Goomba]] and the first companion to join [[Mario]] on his quest. She provides tattle information to Mario about his location or the character who stands in front of him throughout his journey.

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: Goombella":[https://www.mariowiki.com/Goombella]

title: monk_(ogiverse)
body:
Appearance of Buddhist monks in Jo Shin Ogi's paintings:
* Orange hair and orange eyes
* Large and round breasts
* Female
* Meditate and practice Buddhism on weekdays
But sometimes they will [[tribadism|scissoring]] with donors or another monk with orange hair and orange eyes like her.
Despite this, the image of Buddhist monks in Jo Shin Ogi's paintings is unified, and the color is unified in orange (the World Buddhist Association represents Dharma, solemnity, and wisdom. Mahayana Buddhism represents "forbearance").

title: plankton_(spongebob)
body:
[i]"Hear me, [[Mr. Krabs|Krabs]]! When I discover your formula for Krabby Patties, I‚Äôll run you out of business! I went to college!"[/i]
‚Äî [i]PLANKTON'S FIRST LINES, IN THE EPISODE "PLANKTON!":[https://spongebob.fandom.com/wiki/Plankton!][/i]

[b]Sheldon J. Plankton[/b], most commonly known as [b]Plankton[/b], is one of the ten main characters of the [[Spongebob Squarepants (series)|]] series. He is a planktonic copepod who runs the Chum Bucket restaurant alongside [[Karen Plankton|Karen]], a waterproof computer who is his sidekick and wife. The Chum Bucket is highly unpopular in Bikini Bottom because it serves chum, a type of bait made from fish meat.

He is the central and main antagonist of the franchise. There are also several and many episodes in which Plankton acts as a sympathetic anti-hero. Plankton despises his rival, Mr. Krabs for running a successful restaurant because his own business rarely gets any customers. His main goal is to steal Krabs' secret formula for Krabby Patties and running Mr. Krabs out of business. Karen gives him a variety of plans to steal it, but their efforts always end up failing in the process.

h4. External links

* "Sheldon J. Plankton | Encyclopedia SpongeBobia | Fandom":[https://spongebob.fandom.com/wiki/Sheldon_J._Plankton]

title: starlow
body:
[i]"HELLO YELLO!"[/i]
     ‚Äî[b]Starlow[/b], [i]Mario & Luigi series[/i]

[b]Starlow[/b] (also known by the pseudonym [b]Chippy[/b] by [[bowser|Bowser]] when she is keeping a low profile in [i][[Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story]][/i] and [i][[Mario & Luigi: Brothership]][/i]) is a major character in the [i][[mario & luigi rpg|Mario & Luigi series]][/i], who debuted in [i][[Mario & Luigi: Bowser's Inside Story]][/i]. She is a Star Sprite who helps [[Mario]] and [[Luigi]] by giving hints and holding items. She has a similar role and personality to [[Stuffwell]] from [i][[Mario & Luigi: Partners in Time]][/i]. Her name is a portmanteau of "star" and "yellow".

title: spongebob_squarepants
body:
The titular character of [[SpongeBob Squarepants (series)|]]. He is a yellow anthromorphic sea sponge with overly energetic yet somewhat clueless personality. He works as a frycook for [[Mr. Krabs]] at his Krabby Patty, and is typically tag along with his friend [[Patrick Star]].

title: king_bob-omb
body:
[b]King Bob-omb[/b] (formerly known as the [b]Big Bob-omb[/b]) is a character introduced in [[Super Mario 64]].

As his name suggests he is the King of the [[Bob-omb]]s, and a reoccurring boss character often closely allied with [[Bowser]]. [[Super Mario 64 DS]] and [[Mario & Luigi: Paper Jam]] implies that he looks down of those without mustaches.

He has a proud white [[mustache]], a gold [[crown]], wears [[white gloves]] and has [[yellow footwear|yellow]] [[pointy footwear|pointy shoes]]. Despite himself being a bomb, he lacks the winding key and fuse of his underlings.

h4. Official Art

* !post #6488549

h4. External links

* "Super Mario Wiki: King Bob-omb":[https://www.mariowiki.com/King_Bob-omb]

title: dancing_spear_guy
body:
[b]Dancing Spear Guys[/b] are a more energetic variety of Spear Guys that first appear in [[Super Mario World 2: Yoshi's Island]]. They are generally orange or yellow in color and are commonly depicted as having green paint on their [[mask]], although sometimes they appear in red. Dancing Spear Guys lack the shield and the feather held by Spear Guys.

title: parakarry
body:
[i]"Another letter, duly delivered. A postman's job is never done."[/i]
‚Äî [b]Parakarry[/b], [i]Paper Mario[/i]

[b]Parakarry[/b] is [[Paper Mario (character)|Mario]]'s fourth party member in [[Paper Mario 64|Paper Mario]]. He is a cyan-shelled [[Koopa Paratroopa]] wearing a flight helmet, [[brown footwear|brown shoes]], and a [[mailbag|mail bag]], and is the Mushroom Kingdom‚Äôs primary mail carrier, delivering Princess Peach‚Äôs party invitation to Mario and [[Paper Luigi|Luigi]], which begins the events of Paper Mario.

title: molly_mcgee
body:
[b]Molly McGee[/b] is the titular protagonist from [[The Ghost and Molly McGee]]. She is a 13-year-old Irish-Thai-American girl who meets a grumpy ghost named [[Scratch (the ghost and molly mcgee)|]], who after a curse he tries to put on her backfires, ends up cursed forever by Molly‚Äôs presence.

title: luigi
body:
[b]Luigi[/b] is [[Mario]]'s younger, but taller, twin brother. 

Luigi has assisted and fought alongside his brother on many occasions. Throughout his life, he has lived in Mario's shadow, developing both cowardly and heroic tendencies. [[Mario Bros.]] marks his first appearance in a Super Mario  arcade game. Originally a color swap of Mario, Luigi was created to facilitate a second player option. Since the two player mode was dropped from most [[Mario (series)|Super Mario]] games beginning with Super Mario Land, Luigi had gained his own identity and personality.

title: mario
body:
[b]Mario[/b] ([b]„Éû„É™„Ç™[/b]) is the main protagonist of the [[mario (series)|Mario series]], the legendary mascot of [[Nintendo]], and basically the video game equivalent of [[Mickey Mouse]]. 

Mario is normally a [[plumber]], but in games, he uses his legendary [[jumping]] and combat abilities to defend the inhabitants of the usually peaceful Mushroom World from power-hungry villains such as [[Bowser]]. During most of his adventures, he often teams up with his brother [[Luigi]] and their partner [[Yoshi]] for extra support, as they are the only two characters he fully trusts to help him. When not adventuring, Mario participates in a variety of [[playing sports|sporting events]] and even works as one of his alter-egos, [[Dr. Mario]].

title: greatest_freakout_ever
body:
"Greatest Freakout Ever" is a meme originating from a 2009 "YouTube video":[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YersIyzsOpc] of the same name. In the video, Jack introduces himself to the camera and tells the viewers that his brother, Stephen, is freaking out because his [[World of Warcraft]] account was deleted by their mother. Jack then runs into Stephen's room to place the camera before running out just in time for [[stephen_quire|Stephen]] to storm in and start violently thrashing on his bed. He then gets tangled up in his blanket, threatening to "run away and never come back". After untangling himself from his blanket, he stands up, walks into his closet, and returns a few seconds later to thrash on his bed before he grabs a nearby TV remote and attempts to shove it up his butt. After that, he breaks down, smashing a shoe onto his head several times and continuing to thrash on the bed before his father yells offscreen for him to shut up. Finally coming down, he stands up, punches the bed, and calmly walks out. The last thing the viewer sees is Jack running in to retrieve the camera.

The moment where Stephen shoves the remote up his butt has become a focal point for fans of "Greatest Freakout Ever", with comments referencing it like "at least he didn't shove *insert item name* up his butt!"

title: class_of_09
body:
[b]Class of '09[/b] is an English-language visual novel that was originally released in June 2021. The story follows [[Nicole (class_of_09)|]], an American high school student navigating her junior year at her new school in 2008. A standalone visual novel called [b]Class of '09: The Re-Up[/b], was released on June 2023, which focuses on Nicole's senior year in 2009.

A spin-off called [b]Class of '09: The Flip Side[/b] released on 23 September 2024, mainly focusing on Nicole's best friend [[Jecka (class_of_09)|]], and their experiences post-graduation. In addition, a pilot episode for an anime adaptation was released on 14 December 2024.

The game is infamous for its adult themes and dark subject matter about being an American high school girl in the late 2000's.

h4. External Links
* "Class of '09 on Steam":[https://store.steampowered.com/app/1443200/Class_of_09/]

title: toaster_oven
body:
A small countertop [[oven]] used for toasting like a [[toaster]] and limited baking.  This tag includes all ovens that'd be placed on the counter due to their visual similarity, this includes both toaster ovens and countertop regular style ovens .  Countertop regular ovens are the common type of oven in Japanese households due to space limitations preventing them from having a free-standing or wall oven unit.

There is some visual similarity between a toaster/countertop oven and a [[microwave]].  Visual differences include placement of a door handles, with oven handles being at the top with door opening downward and microwaves having handles on the side with the door usually opening to the side.  Ovens may feature metal racks inside of them, something microwaves can no have in them, while a microwave may have a glass carousel dish inside them to rotate items inside of them for even heating.

h4. Examples

* !post #1571736:  Toaster Oven
* !post #5225802:  Countertop Oven
* !post #4825907:  Microwave Oven
* !post #5571867:  Toaster Oven above Microwave Oven
* !post #5707881:  Toaster Oven on counter and Microwave above fridge

title: michaela_(evillious_nendaiki)
body:
Character from the [[Evillious Nendaiki]] and a side character of the [[Aku no Musume (series)|]] series. Portrayed by [[Hatsune Miku]].

"[i]A green woman from the neighboring country[/i], a maid with a beautiful singing voice. In early fanworks she was often mistakenly portrayed as a [[princess]]. [spoiler]She is a spirit from the Millennium Forest who took human form to help [[Elluka Clockworker]] in her quest for retrieve the [[Vessel of Sin|Vessels of Sin]]. She's a close friend of [[Gumillia]]. She takes the form of a blue [[bird|robin]] in spirit form, and made her human form based on [[Eve Moonlit]] after witnessing the events of [[moonlit bear (vocaloid)|]].[/spoiler]

[spoiler]In the second period, she was known as [[Lich Arklow]]'s younger brother Michael and was one of [[Levia barisol]]'s assistants. Michael Arklow was misread by [[Held Yggdra]] as "Michaela", leading to her gaining it as a nickname. She was engaged to Levia's other assistant [[Gumillia|Gumillia Matsumoto]]. Since she regained her memories of the Second Period and still chose to appear in her female form after the end of the world, she is considered to be a transgender woman.[/spoiler]

After being found by the outcast [[Clarith]], both girls grew close and eventually arrived to Aceid, the capital city of Elphegort, where they were hired by Freezis family, eventually meeting the King [[Kyle Marlon]]. This fateful encounter led to the invasion Lucifenia against Elphegort, in which she was killed by "a golden haired assassin". [spoiler]This is implied to be [[Allen Avadonia]], but is actually [[Ney Phutapie]].[/spoiler]

[spoilers]After her death, she was reincarnated as a tree and was chosen to succeed [[Held Yggdra|Held]] as the new Deity of the Millennium Forest.[/spoilers]

h4. See Also
* [[List of Evillious Nendaiki characters]]

title: lord_camelot_(fate)
body:
[[Mash Kyrielight]]'s [spoilers]and by extension [[Galahad (fate)|]]'s[/spoilers] large black shield. A shield made from the Round Table of Camelot where the [[Knights of the Round Table (fate)|]] would sit. It is capable of repelling attacks, so long as the user's willpower doesn't falter. It also grants its user and Master an anti-poison ward, and is the catalyst used for summoning Servants in [[Fate/Grand Order]]. In the Olympus Lostbelt, it gains an additional cannon-like weapon called the Black Barrel, which is capable of destroying gods.

It was originally designed to be [[Tachie (fate)|]]'s shield, but her character was scrapped from [[Fate/Stay Night]] and repurposed as Mash for FGO.

Not to be confused with the shield she wields in her [[Mash Kyrielight (Ortenaus)|Ortenaus]] form, [[Mold Camelot]].

h4.External Links

* "Lord Camelot on Type-Moon Wiki":https://typemoon.fandom.com/wiki/Lord_Camelot

title: pastry_bag
body:
Also called a piping bag, it is a handheld bag made from cloth or paper for piping semi-solid foods. It is filled through a wider opening at the opposite end, rolled or twisted closed, and then squeezed to extrude its contents. The most popular usage is for [[icing]], although pastries and garnishes can also be created this way.

body: A covenant weapon from [[halo (series)|Halo]] that fires crystal needles. Each needle homes in on whatever living entity is closest when firing. These needles, when compounded enough, will generate a small explosion that usually kills the target.

title: halo_installation
body: A ring-like space structure in [[Halo (series)|]]. These contain very similar and recognizable architecture all throughout, and a number of different biomes on the interior side of the ring. There are no fauna inhabiting those biomes- only flora. Each installation is tended to by an AI caretaker.

title: ventilator_(medical)
body: A piece of medical equipment designed to assist a patient who has difficulty breathing, or, in extreme cases, cannot breathe on their own. Not to be confused with [[ventilator]], which is an apparatus to bring fresh air into a building, room, the interior of a ship, etc., or [[respirator]], a face mask intended to help the wearer breathe safely in hazardous atmospheric conditions.

title: ventilator
body: An apparatus to bring fresh air into an enclosed space, such as a building, room, or the interior of a ship. Often takes the form of a grille or grating on a wall.

title: reclining
body:
A more relaxed form of [[sitting]] where the character is leaning back but not entirely [[lying]] down.

h4. See also

* [[Tag group:Posture]]

title: ai-chan_(kyata_ti666)
body:
Also known as: Robot-chan.

Ai-chan's name is a pun of the word "A.I" - a play on the fact she is an artificial intelligence. Has a dry wit, curiosity for human behavior and a slight superiority complex.

title: sparse_stubble
body: A [[stubble]] comprised of only a few loose hairs, rather than a dense mat of hair in typical stubbles.

title: paimon_(genshin_impact)
body:
A [[Genshin Impact]] character.

A fairy-like being who accompanies the Traveler throughout their adventure in Teyvat as their guide.
She also serves as the mascot of Genshin Impact, being depicted on the app, website, and social media icons.

Her nickname within much of the Genshin Impact community is "Emergency Food". See pool #16460.

She appears in [[Honkai Impact 3rd]] as an event emblem.

Chinese CV: [[Duoduo Poi]], a [[Virtual YouTuber]].
Japanese CV: [[Koga Aoi]]

title: tall_miku_short_teto_(meme)
body:
A [[meme]] started by [[Channel (caststation)|]] after someone requested that they draw a super-tall [[Hatsune Miku]]. They did so with [[Kasane Teto (SV)]] standing behind her to compare the [[height difference]].

Artists soon adopted this concept and drew tall Miku and Teto interacting in various ways, usually Miku easily [[lifting person|picking up]] Teto.

* !post #7859184: Original post
